headline.seo: Wladimir Klitschko Retains World Heavyweight Belts
headline.main: Wladimir Klitschko Retains World Heavyweight Belts

docs.snippet: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to keep a comfortable hold on his W.B.A., I.B.F. and W.B.O. heavyweight titles Saturday night....
docs.abstract: Wladimir Klitschko stops Tony Thompson in the sixth round in Bern, Switzerland, to retain his World Boxing Association, International Boxing Federation and World Boxing Organization heavyweight title belts.
docs.lead_paragraph: Wladimir Klitschko stopped Tony Thompson in the sixth round to keep a comfortable hold on his W.B.A., I.B.F. and W.B.O. heavyweight titles Saturday night.

headline.seo: Portland Trail Blazers President Larry Miller Resigns

docs.snippet: Larry Miller has resigned as the president of the Portland Trail Blazers. The team said that Miller, who had two years left on his contract, was taking a position with another Portland-area business....
docs.lead_paragraph: Larry Miller has resigned as the president of the Portland Trail Blazers. The team said that Miller, who had two years left on his contract, was taking a position with another Portland-area business.

docs.snippet: Minnesota Vikings star running back Adrian Peterson was arrested on a charge of resisting arrest after an early morning incident where police say it took three officers to subdue him....
docs.abstract: Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson is arrested on a charge of resisting arrest after an incident in a Houston nightclub in which the police say it took three officers to subdue him; other football news noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Minnesota Vikings star running back Adrian Peterson was arrested on a charge of resisting arrest after an early morning incident where police say it took three officers to subdue him.

headline.print_headline: A Young Syrian’s Evolution From a Carefree Tour Guide to a Revolutionary
headline.seo: A Syrian’s Evolution From Carefree to Revolutionary
headline.main: A Young Syrian’s Evolution From a Carefree Tour Guide to a Revolutionary

docs.snippet: A Bedouin man has struggled with uncertainty over whether joining a revolt was life’s proudest moment or its ruin — or both....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Abu Zeid's evolution from carefree tour guide to Syrian revolutionary offers a rare glimpse of a life transformed by an uprising that has jolted thousands from their daily routines; he and several friends took up arms after security officers shot demonstrators in Tadmur; now, alternately passionate and confused, he has only the dimmest idea of an endgame and has taken refuge in Lebanon.

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Syria, and another employee of The Times from a neighboring country.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Bedouin man has struggled with uncertainty over whether joining a revolt was life’s proudest moment or its ruin — or both.

headline.print_headline: One Player Rises As Wind Replaces Heat at the Open
headline.seo: Choi Shoots 65 to Take Lead at U.S. Women’s Open
headline.main: One Player Rises as Wind Replaces Heat at the Open

docs.snippet: Michelle Wie shot a U.S. Women’s Open course record in the second round, but Na Yeon Choi did her one better the next day on the blustery Blackwolf Run course....
docs.abstract: Na Yeon Choi takes third-round lead at the United States Women’s Open golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: Michelle Wie shot a U.S. Women’s Open course record in the second round, but Na Yeon Choi did her one better the next day on the blustery Blackwolf Run course.

headline.print_headline: On Tricky Terrain of Class, Contrasting Paths
headline.seo: Obama and Romney Gamble on Wealth Divide
headline.main: On Tricky Terrain of Class, Contrasting Paths

docs.snippet: Class politics are surfacing in increasingly visible ways in the campaign between President Obama and Mitt Romney, presenting big risks and opportunities to both sides....
docs.abstract: Political Memo; complex and fraught politics of wealth and class underlying the race between Pres Obama and Mitt Romney are surfacing in increasingly visible ways, presenting big risks and opportunities to both sides; dynamic is exemplified by Pres Obama's weekend appearances at blue-collar locations in Ohio, while Romney vacationed in New Hampshire and collected large donations in East Hampton, NY.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mark Landler from Oak Harbor, Ohio; Jim Rutenberg from New York; and Jeremy W. Peters from Wolfeboro, N.H.

docs.lead_paragraph: Class politics are surfacing in increasingly visible ways in the campaign between President Obama and Mitt Romney, presenting big risks and opportunities to both sides.

docs.lead_paragraph: Webb Simpson avoided bogeys for the second straight round and leads the Greenbrier Classic.

headline.print_headline: Groups Shield Political Gifts Of Businesses
headline.main: Tax-Exempt Groups Shield Political Gifts of Businesses

docs.snippet: Corporations are funding policy organizations that are free of the disclosure rules applying to parties, candidates and PACs....

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Review by the New York Times finds that many large corporations are trying to influence campaigns and policy decisions by donating money to tax-exempt organizations that can spend millions of dollars without being subject to the disclosure requirements that apply to candidates, parties and PACs; secrecy shrouding the groups makes a full accounting of corporate influence on the electoral process impossible.

byline.original: By MIKE McINTIRE and NICHOLAS CONFESSORE

docs.lead_paragraph: Corporations are funding policy organizations that are free of the disclosure rules applying to parties, candidates and PACs.
